00001 /**
00002  * \file MPFRNormal.hpp
00003  * \brief Header for MPFRNormal
00004  *
00005  * Sampling exactly from the normal distribution for MPFR.
00006  *

00008  * the MIT/X11 License.  For more information, see
00009  * http://randomlib.sourceforge.net/
00010  **********************************************************************/
00011 
00012 #if !defined(RANDOMLIB_MPFRNORMAL_HPP)
00013 #define RANDOMLIB_MPFRNORMAL_HPP \
00014   "$Id: 058b4357936d14651b87f0876d3973f49be2a779 $"
00015 
00016 #include <algorithm>            // for max/min
00017 #include <RandomLib/MPFRRandom.hpp>
00018 
00019 namespace RandomLib {
00020 
00021   /**
00022    * \brief The normal distribution for MPFR.
00023    *
00024    * This is a transcription of ExactNormal (version 1.3) for use with MPFR.
00025    *
00026    * This class uses mutable private objects.  So a single MPFRNormal object
00027    * cannot safely be used by multiple threads.  In a multi-processing
00028    * environment, each thread should use a thread-specific MPFRNormal object.
00029    *
00030    * @tparam bits the number of bits in each digit.
00031    **********************************************************************/
00032   template<int bits = 32> class MPFRNormal {
00033   public:
00034 
00035     /**
00036      * Initialize the MPFRNormal object.
00037      **********************************************************************/
00038     MPFRNormal() { mpz_init(_tt); }
00039     /**
00040      * Destroy the MPFRNormal object.
00041      **********************************************************************/
00042     ~MPFRNormal() { mpz_clear(_tt); }
00043     /**
00044      * Sample from the normal distribution with mean 0 and variance 1 returning
00045      * a MPFRRandom.
00046      *
00047      * @param[out] t the MPFRRandom result.
00048      * @param[in,out] r a GMP random generator.
00049      **********************************************************************/
00050     void operator()(MPFRRandom<bits>& t,gmp_randstate_t r) const
00051     { Compute(r); return _x.swap(t); }
00052     /**
00053      * Sample from the normal distribution with mean 0 and variance 1.
00054      *
00055      * @param[out] val the sample from the normal distribution
00056      * @param[in,out] r a GMP random generator.
00057      * @param[in] round the rounding direction.
00058      * @return the MPFR ternary result (+1/-1 if val is larger/smaller than the
00059      *   exact sample).
00060      **********************************************************************/
00061     int operator()(mpfr_t val, gmp_randstate_t r, mpfr_rnd_t round) const
00062     { Compute(r); return _x(val, r, round); }
00063   private:
00064     // Disable copy constructor and assignment operator
00065     MPFRNormal(const MPFRNormal&);
00066     MPFRNormal& operator=(const MPFRNormal&);
00067     // True with prob exp(-1/2)
00068     int ExpProbH(gmp_randstate_t r) const {
00069       _p.Init(); if (_p.TestHighBit(r)) return 1;
00070       // von Neumann rejection
00071       while (true) {
00072         _q.Init(); if (!_q.LessThan(r, _p)) return 0;
00073         _p.Init(); if (!_p.LessThan(r, _q)) return 1;
00074       }
00075     }
00076     // True with prob exp(-n/2)
00077     int ExpProb(gmp_randstate_t r, unsigned n) const {
00078       while (n--) { if (!ExpProbH(r)) return 0; }
00079       return 1;
00080     }
00081     // n with prob (1-exp(-1/2)) * exp(-n/2)
00082     unsigned ExpProbN(gmp_randstate_t r) const {
00083       unsigned n = 0;
00084       while (ExpProbH(r)) ++n;
00085       return n;
00086     }
00087     // Return:
00088     //  1 with prob 2k/(2k + 2)
00089     //  0 with prob  1/(2k + 2)
00090     // -1 with prob  1/(2k + 2)
00091     int Choose(gmp_randstate_t r, int k) const {
00092       const int b = 15;           // To avoid integer overflow on multiplication
00093       const int m = 2 * k + 2;
00094       int n1 = m - 2, n2 = m - 1;
00095       while (true) {
00096         mpz_urandomb(_tt, r, b);
00097         int d = int( mpz_get_ui(_tt) ) * m;
00098         n1 = std::max((n1 << b) - d, 0);
00099         if (n1 >= m) return 1;
00100         n2 = std::min((n2 << b) - d, m);
00101         if (n2 <= 0) return -1;
00102         if (n1 == 0 && n2 == m) return 0;
00103       }
00104     }
00105     void Compute(gmp_randstate_t r) const {
00106       while (true) {
00107         unsigned k = ExpProbN(r); // the integer part of the result.
00108         if (ExpProb(r, (k - 1) * k)) {
00109           _x.Init();
00110           unsigned s = 1;
00111           for (unsigned j = 0; j <= k; ++j) { // execute k + 1 times
00112             bool first;
00113             for (s = 1, first = true; ; s ^= 1, first = false) {
00114               if (k == 0 && _x.Boolean(r)) break;
00115               _q.Init(); if (!_q.LessThan(r, first ? _x : _p)) break;
00116               int y = k == 0 ? 0 : Choose(r, k);
00117               if (y < 0)
00118                 break;
00119               else if (y == 0) {
00120                 _p.Init(); if (!_p.LessThan(r, _x)) break;
00121               }
00122               _p.swap(_q);        // a fast way of doing p = q
00123             }
00124             if (s == 0) break;
00125           }
00126           if (s != 0) {
00127             _x.AddInteger(k);
00128             if (_x.Boolean(r)) _x.Negate();
00129             return;
00130           }
00131         }
00132       }
00133     }
00134     mutable mpz_t _tt;          // A temporary
00135     mutable MPFRRandom<bits> _x;
00136     mutable MPFRRandom<bits> _p;
00137     mutable MPFRRandom<bits> _q;
00138   };
00139 
00140 } // namespace RandomLib
00141 
00142 #endif  // RANDOMLIB_MPFRNORMAL_HPP
